newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria endorses $38 mln oil deal with Malaysia.
newsitem.headline: Algeria endorses $38 mln oil deal with Malaysia.

text.p: Algeria on Wednesday approved a $37.8 million oil and gas exploration deal between Algerian state-owned oil and gas firm Sonatrach and Malaysia's Petronas Carigali Overseas.

The official Algerian news agency APS reported a cabinet statement that Petronas Carigali Overseas, a subsidiary of the Malaysian state company Petronas, will carry out three years of seismic research in El Hadjira Oued el Maraa in the southern province of Ouargla.

Under the production sharing contract, Petronas Carigali Overseas will also sink four exploration wells. The two firms had signed the deal in December 1996, pending formal approval by the governments.

Algeria's main oilfied, Hassi Messaoud, lies in the Ouargla area. Sonatrach had already reached similar deals with more than 30 foreign companies to tap oil and gas resources in the North African country.
Hydrocarbons provide Algeria with more than 90 percent of its total exports. The value of the country's oil and gas export was $12.6 billion in 1996, up 29 percent from the previous year.
